text: The George Washington University Hospital is the hub of a major medical center in Washington, D.C. in the United States. It is affiliated with the George Washington University School of Medicine and Health Sciences. The current building was opened on August 23, 2002. Since 1997, The George Washington University Hospital has been jointly owned and operated by a parnership between a subsidiary of Universal Health Services and The George Washington University. In 1981 after being shot, Ronald Reagan was taken to the hospital. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Buildings and structures in Washington, D.C. Category:University hospitals in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Washington, D.C. Category:George Washington University
title: George Washington University Hospital
